products.name: From Auckland: Rotorua MÄori Village & Polynesian Spa Small Group Tour
products.shortDescription: Embark on a cultural journey like no other with our Whakarewarewa Village Day Tour. Step into the vibrant world of the Maori people as you explore this living village nestled amidst Rotoruaâ€™s geothermal wonders.
products.description:
Begin your tour with a scenic bus ride from Auckland to Rotorua, where you arrive at the enchanting Whakarewarewa Village. Step into this living MÄori village and be greeted by the warmth of the local community and the rich aroma of geothermal steam rising from the earth.


Guided by knowledgeable locals, embark on a cultural exploration of Whakarewarewa, discovering the fascinating traditions, customs, and lifestyle of the MÄori people. Marvel at the bubbling mud pools, spouting geysers, and steaming vents that dot the landscape, each with its own story to tell.


Immerse yourself in the captivating performances of traditional MÄori songs and dances, which offer a glimpse into the vibrant heritage and enduring spirit of this indigenous culture. Interact with locals, learn about their ancient customs, and gain insight into their deep connection to the land.


After your enriching experience at Whakarewarewa Village, it's time to unwind and rejuvenate at the world-renowned Polynesian Spa. Nestled amidst picturesque surroundings, the spa offers a tranquil oasis where you can relax and soak in the healing mineral waters.


Indulge in the therapeutic benefits of the spa's natural geothermal pools, each filled with mineral-rich waters sourced from deep beneath the earth's surface. Whether you choose to immerse yourself in the soothing alkaline waters or enjoy the rejuvenating effects of the acidic springs, emerge feeling refreshed and revitalized.


Take in the stunning views of Lake Rotorua and the surrounding forests as you soak away any tension and stress, letting the natural beauty of the landscape envelop you in a sense of peace and tranquility. After a blissful afternoon of relaxation, board the bus for your return journey to Auckland.

products.name: Birrang Gulaay, Signature Indigenous Cultural Experience
products.shortDescription: Birrang Gulaay â€˜crossing from where you have been to where you are headedâ€™
products.description:
Birrang Gulaay â€˜crossing from where you have been to where you are headedâ€™

 â€œThe idea of
this as the name is that in each instance the clients will arrive from where
theyâ€™ve been, will go through ceremony involving ochre, will begin a
facilitated cultural journey of personal immersion through story, painting,
meditation, experiential, conversation, realisation, food and tangible
outcomes. The name really means crossing from where theyâ€™ve been to where
theyâ€™re headed by immersion in the Importance of place."

 Allow 4.5 hours 

1. Guests are greeted by Birrunga Wiradyuri.

2. Birrunga will do an Acknowledgement of Country 

3. Ochre ceremony. Birrunga
will cleanse the space using ochre and draw the symbol of the experience with
the ochre to anchor the intention of the experience. 

4. Importance of Place
workshop. 

  • Discuss the concept of Importance of Place in Aboriginal culture
    and how that can relate to clients experience 
  • Share stories of personal and
    family lore 
  • Share Wiradyuri central lore 
  • Discuss painting technique wet on
    wet 
  • Demonstrate painting 
  • Didgeridoo meditation 
  • Clients to paint their own
    canvas 
  • Share experience with the group 
  • Canvas will be left to dry at the
    gallery and posted to client once dry, with a personal hand written note from
    Birrunga 

5. Guests taken to a cultural space and introduced to degustation by General
Manager 

  • 5 course degustation menu infused with native ingredients.
  • Birrunga to join clients and share the meal experience. During
    which time clients will have the opportunity to unpack the workshop experience
    with Birrunga and Birrunga will share more cultural stories.

 6. Private guided cultural tour with Birrunga. Birrunga will talk about the Creative Cultural
Development Program and the team of young Aboriginal artists he mentors. He
will share stories of their artwork and development alongside truth-telling and
stories of his own personal works on display in the space. 

7. Birrunga will
farewell guests and invite them to relax in the space for as long as
they like before he departs.

In the afternoon, the bus will be waiting for you at the end of the track at 3pm (or a time that the driver lets you know in the morning).  We then take you back to your original pick up location.  


Turangi is a town close to the Tongariro River only 45 mins to the start of the track and only 20 mins at the end of the day from Ketetahi back to Turangi.

products.name: Shaka Guide Cuyahoga Valley National Park Audio Tour
products.shortDescription: Explore the enchanting Cuyahoga Valley National Park, where lush forests, scenic trails, and serene waterways await. Immerse yourself in nature's beauty and discover the park's captivating landscapes.
products.description:
Cuyahoga Valley National Park, nestled between Cleveland and Akron, is a unique blend of natural beauty and cultural history. Its picturesque landscapes, including waterfalls, forests, and the winding Cuyahoga River, provide a serene escape, while historic sites like the Ohio and Erie Canal add a touch of the region's rich heritage.

Here are just a few of the fun things you can do on the tour!

â€¢ Go on a nostalgic journey through the park on the Cuyahoga Valley Scenic Railroad where youâ€™ll get picturesque views of the river, forests, and historic sites.

â€¢ Visit Brandywine Falls, a captivating 65-foot waterfall surrounded by lush greenery, accessible by a short trail, making it a must-see natural gem in Cuyahoga Valley National Park.

â€¢ Hike the Ohio & Erie Canal Towpath Trail which winds through the park, following the historic canal route and providing hikers and bikers with a scenic and historic journey through the valley.

â€¢ Check out Hale Farm & Village, a living history museum that allows visitors to step back in time and experience 19th-century rural life, complete with historic buildings, demonstrations, and hands-on activities.

â€¢ Hike the Ledges Trail through stunning sandstone formations and moss-covered rocks.

KNOW BEFORE YOU GO:

Recommended Start Time: Before 9:00 a.m.
Tour Starting Point(s): The tour has four starting points: Interstate 77 North & South and Interstate 480 East & West
Time to complete: 8 hours

products.name: Go-Big-Or-Go-Home Tour (2-Day Dubai & Abu Dhabi City Tour)
products.shortDescription: Go-Big-Or-Go-Home Tour (2-Day Dubai & Abu Dhabi Tour) is the perfect way to spend two days in Dubai and Abu Dhabi (either first as per your preference.
products.description:
Go-Big-Or-Go-Home Tour (2-Day Dubai & Abu Dhabi Tour) is the perfect way to spend two days in Dubai and Abu Dhabi (either first as per your preference. Let us show you both of these cities in a way that will appeal to all your senses and have you leave with a deep understanding of the UAE's past, regional command, and emerging international presence.

In Dubai, everything is bigger and better. Itâ€™s home to the worldâ€™s tallest building, the largest mall, the biggest indoor theme park, and the largest Ferris Wheel. The city is constantly evolving under the leadership of the visionary Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum.

At the heart of the glitz and glam, however, is a city with a rich cultural heritage. Dubai first made its name as a fishing and pearling village and as a strategic port on the Persian Gulf. Even with modern developments, the cityâ€™s history is still alive in an area where one can savor a cup of traditional coffee, catch a ride on an old-fashioned abra, or shop in the traditional souks.

This city tour will show you the oldest neighborhood of Dubai to the tallest building in the world and is an amazing way to see the highlights of Dubai in a day at your leisure. Each day can be customized to your interests. You also have the option to add on a few other activities like getting on top of the Burj Khalifa or ending the day with a beautiful ride on a yacht, taking in some great views the city has to offer.

Highlights of the tour:

We will start the day walking through the Al Fahidi Historical Neighborhood, through the souks. This two-hour walking tour is the perfect introduction to the history and culture of the UAE. You will learn firsthand about unique Gulf Arab traditions and you will see the historic buildings and souks that pre-date modern times. Specifically, you will see:

  • Historical neighborhood Al Fahidi District
  • Coffee Museum and Dubai Museum
  • Textile, Spice, and Gold Souks
  • Traditional Abra Ride (wooden boat) across the creek
  • Dubai Mall, seeing the Burj Khalifa, Dubai Opera, and overlooking the Dancing Fountains. You can add tickets to the 148th floor of the Burj Khalifa.
  • Souk Madinat
  • Kite Beach
  • Burj Al Arab (from the outside)
  • The Palm Jumeirah (from the outside)

If you wish to see the View of the Palm and the Burj Al Arab from the inside, we can cover that at an additional cost.

The next day, we will pick you up from your hotel and start the day by visiting Abu Dhabi. 

Experience highlights of Abu Dhabi, UAEâ€™s capital, and largest state by land and population and an emerging global center for art, faith, and culture. On this one-day city tour, we visit the humbling Grand Mosque, the multi-faith Abrahamic Family House, and the Louvre Abu Dhabi.

This tour begins with a pick-up in the morning from your hotel and a 90-minute drive to Abu Dhabi. Pick-up times are adjusted if you are staying in Abu Dhabi. We visit the Grand Mosque together, soaking in the architecture, the details in its exquisite design by Kevin Dean, in-laid amethyst and mother-of-pearl precious stones, and the worldâ€™s largest hand-knotted Iranian carpet. We visit the newest multi-faith center on Saadiyat Island, the Abhramahic family house featuring a symmetric experience of a mosque, a church, and a synagogue. We head to the Louvre Abu Dhabi for lunch and walk through the permanent galleries and the temporary exhibits. We wind up at the gift shop because museum gift shops are uh-amazing!

The tour brings you to the Louvre Abu Dhabi, which houses a vast collection of art from around the world. From there, visitors can walk to the NYU Abu Dhabi Art Center, which hosts a variety of exhibitions and events throughout the year. The tour can then end at the Abrahamic House, which is dedicated to promoting understanding and tolerance between different religions.

Enjoy a hassle-free tour with round-trip transportation from Dubai, in a comfortable SUV car, private and personalized and informative commentary from your expert guide.

Duration: 6-8 Hours

Whatâ€™s Included:

Â· Pick Up and Drop Off by SUV Car and Driver (anywhere in Dubai or Abu Dhabi)

Â· Guided Tour by Certified Premium Guide

Â· Entrance to the Grand Mosque, Abrahamic Family House & The Louvre

Â· Abayas and shaylas for women

Whatâ€™s Excluded:

Â· Food & Drinks (Usually we stop at the Louvre CafÃ© for Lunch)

Â· Guide gratuity

products.description:
Embark on a captivating tour of Shenandoah National Park, a picturesque gem nestled in the Blue Ridge Mountains of Virginia. 


Journey along the renowned Skyline Drive, a scenic roadway that winds its way through the park, offering breathtaking views of the surrounding landscapes. 


Immerse yourself in the park's natural beauty as you explore diverse hiking trails, visit cascading waterfalls, encounter wildlife, and take in the vibrant colors of the forests during the fall season.

Here are just a few of the fun things you can do on the tour:

â€¢ Gaze over the Shenandoah Valley from Stony Man Overlook, a vantage point that offers breathtaking views of the lush landscape below.

â€¢ Reach the highest peak in Shenandoah National Park at Hawksbill Gap, where panoramic vistas showcase the park's rolling hills and woodlands.

â€¢ Immerse yourself in the expansive beauty of Big Meadows, a picturesque area where wildlife roams freely and vibrant wildflowers adorn the landscape.

â€¢ Experience the enchantment of Dark Hollow Falls as they gracefully cascade through the forest, creating a serene oasis of natural tranquility.

â€¢ Pass through Marys Rock Tunnel and emerge to stunning vistas, a gateway to sweeping panoramas of the surrounding Shenandoah Valley.

KNOW BEFORE YOU GO:

products.name: Emerald Cave Crossing
products.shortDescription:
4-5-hour expertly guided tour.
6-mile round trip flat-water paddle
Highlights include Emerald and Echo Caves, historical sites, and a serene paddle for lunch on an exclusive beach.
products.description:
Are you ready to explore hidden gems north of Emerald Cave? After we pass Emerald and Echo Caves, we will embark on an area of the Black Canyon narrows that are less visited. DIFFICULTY: Easy to moderate, depending on wind conditions.

SKILL LEVEL: Beginner to moderate, based on mileage. 


This tour launches bright and early with the morning Sun. This exclusive launch helps us avoid the crowds at the cave for a more private and personalized experience! Please arrive 30 minutes before departure.

products.name: Whale Watching on vessel ORCA - Manly Wharf Departure - Agent
products.shortDescription: Orca is our newest, fastest and most intimate vessel. Orca only carries a maximum of 12 passengers so is our most personal, boutique experience.  Minimum age is 12 years old.
products.description:
Jump onboard the and take part in Sydney's most personal and most exciting whale watching experience. 

You will be taken on an exciting and unforgettable journey to see the whales in their natural habitat on a purpose-built, military spec, high speed RIB.

Your high-speed whale watching boat departs from Manly Wharf before turning up the power and blasting towards the open ocean. After speeding through the heads and into the Tasman Sea, youâ€™re taken on a high-speed cruise out to see the whales â€“ your skipper is in constant contact with other boat drivers to find the most friendly and approachable whale pods.

*All passengers must be at least 12 years old. Our other vessel, OSPREY, has a minimum age of 6 years old.

The tour departs from the Manly Kayak Centre pontoon located on the Eastern side of the Manly Wharf complex. Please arrive 15 minutes prior to your scheduled departure and wait the top of the stairs for the vessel to arrive. All signing in etc is done on board the vessel and all belongings can be stowed on board.
products.terms: **If whales are not spotted on a whale watching tour, each passenger will be issued with a credit to come on another whale watching tour in the same season. The credit expires at the end of the season and must be used by the original participant (non-transferable). Subject to availability.

bookingFields.label: How did you hear about us?
Confirm all passengers are at least 12 years old.
Confirm that none of the passengers are pregnant or have any back or neck issues.

products.additionalInformation:
We require at least 48 hours notice to reschedule/cancel a booking. 

You must arrive at your departure location at least 15 minutes prior to your scheduled departure time. 

We depart from the Manly Kayak Centre Wharf located next to Manly Wharf Hotel on the eastern side of the Manly Wharf Complex. Our vessel will be arriving from Circular Quay up to 15 minutes prior to the start time on this confirmation. We aim to get everyone onboard and signed in so we can depart at the departure time listed. We can be held up at Circular Quay from time to time so are occasionally a few minutes late arriving in Manly. Just wait the the Kayak Centre and you can't miss the boat.

WHAT TO BRING: 
  • Wind/spray jacket if you have one. If you don't have a jacket you can wear one of ours. You will still need to dress warmly underneath our jacket.
  • It is advised to wear/bring multiple layers of clothing. The temperature offshore can be significantly colder than on land. If it is a very cold day we recommend beanies/balaclavas, gloves, jackets etc. It is always better to be too warm than too cold.  
  • Sunglasses are essential. Even if it's not sunny! It is mainly for the wind.
  • Sunscreen.
  • Cameras are brought onboard at your own risk. We generally do not get wet, however this cannot be guaranteed.
  • We have an area where bags can be stowed safely.
  • If you are prone to motion sickness please visit a pharmacy to enquire as to the appropriate remedy before travelling.  
If you would prefer to depart from Circular Quay please email bookings@oceanextreme.com.au 

Please make use of the restrooms at Manly Wharf before boarding.

**If whales are not spotted on a whale watching tour, each passenger will be issued with a credit to come on another whale watching tour in the same season. The credit expires at the end of the season and must be used by the original participant (non-transferable).

products.name: Running River Gorge Hike - Pick up Townsville
products.shortDescription: If you like a challenge, unexpected and natural beauty this is the hike for you! For an entire day be transported back in time and discover the one of the most serene, untouched and amazing Gorge that Far North Queensland has to offer.
products.description:
Running River Gorge is one of those places people dream about. Surrounded by complete untouched nature, Australian bushland, 

Located 1.5-2hrs from Townsville 

Experience the awe-inspiring beauty of Running River Gorge, a hidden gem nestled in the mountains of Hidden Valley in Far North Queensland. Located just a short distance from Townsville and Ingham, this remarkable site is a must-visit destination. 


Your tour begins with a pick-up in either Townsville or Ingham, where your knowledgeable guide will provide captivating commentary throughout the journey. Learn about the local flora and fauna, uncover fascinating history, and discover interesting sites along the way. 


After a scenic drive through and quick photo opportunity at Little Crystal Creek Waterfalls then through the ancient Paluma Range World Heritage Rainforest , you will arrive at Hidden Valley, where the adventure truly begins. Prepare to be mesmerised as you hike down to the magnificent gorge, surrounded by untouched natural beauty. Take a refreshing dip in the ancient waters of the gorge and feel a sense of tranquility like never before.

Not only will this be an opportunity to experience the diversity of the Australian environment but also the chance to spot some of Australiaâ€™s most iconic wildlife, such as wallabies, emus, platypus, lace monitors and so much more!

You will then be welcome at Hidden Valley Cabins for lunch , a family-run and operated resort, you will be treated like family. As part of the experience, you will enjoy an Aussie-inspired barbecue lunch. The resort takes pride in its off-grid operations, and if time permits, they will give you a tour to showcase how they operate completely off the grid.

During the tour, you may get a glimpse of the resort's sustainable practices, such as solar power generation, water conservation methods, and eco-friendly waste management systems. The resort's commitment to being off the grid not only minimises its environmental impact but also provides a unique and self-sufficient experience for guests.

Exploring the resort and learning about its off-grid operations will give you a deeper appreciation for sustainable living and the efforts taken by Hidden Valley Cabins to provide an eco-friendly retreat in harmony with nature.

From here your journey back to Townsville begins, hop back on board the bus and enjoy the changes the afternoon  brings to life the Valley and Rainforests.

With memories etched in your mind, you will return to your starting point, cherishing the unforgettable experiences of the Running River Gorge Day Tour. 

Join us on this extraordinary journey and create memories that will last a lifetime.

Whatâ€™s included:


- Fully guided commentary 8.5hrs (roughly)

- Transportation in air conditioned tour bus

- BBQ lunch 

- Fully guided hike to Running River Gorge

- Poncho (if wet weather)

- Light refreshments eg bottle of water, light snacks

products.name: Rome: Walking Tour of Romeâ€™s Unique Fountains and Squares
products.shortDescription: Discover Rome's enchanting squares and fountains on a 2-hour walking tour blending art, architecture, and legends, topped off with a delightful ice cream treat! Begin at Piazza di Spagna, home to the Spanish Steps and the intriguing Fontana
products.description: Explore the fanciful squares and fountains of Rome on a 2-hour walking tour that combines art and architecture with legends and ice cream! Start at the Piazza di Spagna at the base of the Spanish Steps. The 135 steps linked the historic Bourbon Spanish Embassy with the TrinitÃ  dei Monti church at the summit. Designed by the architects Francesco de Sanctis and Alessandro Specchi, the Piazza di Spagna includes the interesting Fontana della Barcaccia, a Baroque fountain in the shape of a half-sunken ship. Continue to the Trevi district to see Romeâ€™s most famous fountain. Set against the Palazzo Poli, the Trevi Fountain attracts legions of pilgrims who throw a coin in the water to ensure that one day they will return to Rome. Walk on to the Pantheon, dedicated to the Olympian gods and one of the best preserved monuments of Ancient Rome. Once inside, you can marvel at the worldâ€™s largest non-reinforced concrete dome. Your next stop will be the Piazza Navona, built on the site of the Stadium of Domitian. Now one of the most elaborate of Romeâ€™s Baroque squares, among its many highlights is Berniniâ€™s Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi (Fountain of the Four Rivers). End at the Campo deâ€™ Fiori (Field of Flowers), former site of a medieval market and used for public executions. In the center of the square youâ€™ll see a bronze statue of the Dominican friar and philosopher Giordano Bruno, who was burnt at the stake for heresy in 1600.

products.name: Colosseum Express Guided Tour
products.shortDescription: Experience the Colosseum's grandeur with a guided tour, then explore the Roman Forum and Palatine Hill at your own pace. Skip the lines, dive into ancient history, and soak in Rome's breathtaking views.
products.description:
Step into the ancient world with a guided tour of the Colosseum, coupled with self-guided exploration of the Roman Forum and Palatine Hill. Begin your journey at the iconic Colosseum, where a knowledgeable guide will lead you through its storied past, detailing the gladiator battles and imperial spectacles that once filled its arena. With skip-the-line access, you'll bypass the queues and dive straight into the heart of ancient Rome's most celebrated monument.

After your guided tour of the Colosseum concludes, you'll have the freedom to explore the Roman Forum and Palatine Hill at your own pace. Armed with newfound knowledge and insights from your Colosseum guide, wander through the ancient ruins of the Forum, passing by temples, basilicas, and monuments that bear witness to the city's rich history.

Then, ascend to the Palatine Hill, where the ruins of imperial palaces offer a glimpse into the opulent lifestyles of ancient Rome's elite. Stroll through the expansive grounds, soaking in panoramic views of the city below while tracing the footsteps of emperors past.

With this unique combination of a guided tour and self-guided exploration, you'll enjoy the best of both worlds: expert insights into the Colosseum's history and architecture, coupled with the freedom to discover the hidden treasures of the Roman Forum and Palatine Hill at your leisure.

products.name: SCENIC DRIVE with CHOCOLATE, CHEESE and ICE CREAM: Burnie Shore Excursion
products.shortDescription: Discover Tasmania's scenic beauty while savoring chocolate, cheese, and ice cream delights on a journey through Penguin, Ashgrove, Van Diemen's, and Sheffield's murals."
products.description:
Indulge in Tasmania's Dairy Delights: A Scenic Drive Paved with Chocolate, Cheese, and Ice Cream Dreams!


Embark on a delectable scenic journey where you'll uncover the finest dairy treasures amidst breathtaking coastal and rural vistas,culminating in the charming murals of Sheffield.

Our adventure begins with a picturesque coastal drive, winding through the quaint village of Penguin, setting the stage for anunforgettable experience.

Our first stop awaits at the renowned AnversChocolate Factory, where heavenly chocolates beckon and you can witness skilledchocolatiers in action, adding an immersive touch to your indulgence. Continuing our culinary exploration, we delve into the artisanal wonders of Ashgrove Cheeses, where each bite offers a symphony of carefully crafted flavors. Then, it's off to sample the award-winning delights of Van Diemen's Ice Cream, a true treat for the senses.

As we journey on, we pause in the charming village of Sheffield, where vibrant murals adorn the streets and majestic Mt Roland gracesthe horizon, offering a moment of serene reflection. Our return trip winds through rolling hills and small farms, offering glimpses of Tasmania's pastoral beauty before concluding in Burnie. Please note, the cost of any refreshments and samples is not included in the tour price, and entry to all three destinations is free of charge.

Join us for a journey that will tantalize your taste buds and enchant your senses.

products.name: Night Stay at Vanila Hotel & Spa
products.shortDescription: Night Stay at Vanila Hotel & Spa
products.description:
Discover the Enchanting Vanila Hotel & Spa in Nosy Be

Experience Authentic Madagascar

Located on the idyllic west coast of Nosy Be, the "Island of Perfumes," the Vanila Hotel & Spa provides a luxurious gateway into the vibrant culture and stunning landscapes of Madagascar. Following its renovation in 2022, the hotel showcases traditional Malagasy architecture, set against the backdrop of an exuberant tropical garden, harmoniously blending into the natural scenery of this cherished island.

Elegant Accommodations with Scenic Views

The accommodations at Vanila Hotel & Spa are a true reflection of the islandâ€™s charm, featuring warm color palettes and furnishings crafted from locally sourced wood. Each room is equipped with modern amenities including satellite TV, air conditioning, and tea-and-coffee-making facilities. Guests can choose from rooms offering diverse views through private terraces, balconies, or direct access to lush gardens, ensuring a serene and picturesque stay.

Diverse Culinary Offerings

Vanila Hotel & Spa boasts two exceptional dining venues. The Parfum Vanille restaurant serves a wide array of buffet-style breakfasts and dinners, while the Grill Del Sol offers an Ã  la carte dining experience, focusing on gourmet dishes that incorporate local flavors. Both restaurants are dedicated to providing a culinary journey that complements the exotic locale.

Exclusive Facilities for Ultimate Relaxation

Guests at the hotel can indulge in leisure and relaxation with four infinity pools, including a child-friendly option, all overlooking the majestic Indian Ocean. The 200 mÂ² spa at Vanila Hotel offers an extensive range of treatments with facilities that include a hydrotherapy room, multiple massage rooms, Jacuzzis, a Hammam, and a relaxation room.

Activities for the Adventurous

Vanila Hotel & Spa serves as a perfect base for guests eager to explore the island. The hotel offers arrangements for a variety of activities such as horse riding, diving, snorkeling, and golf, providing plentiful opportunities for guests to engage with the natural and cultural richness of Nosy Be.

Convenient Amenities and Acclaimed Service

With free private parking and proximity to popular local attractions like Palm Beach, Vanila Hotel & Spa ensures every aspect of the guest experience is catered to. Guest reviews frequently highlight the hotelâ€™s stunning gardens, excellent dining options, and the unparalleled friendliness and helpfulness of the staff, making it a highly recommended destination for those visiting Madagascar.

Plan Your Visit

Whether seeking a relaxing retreat or an adventurous escape, Vanila Hotel & Spa promises a memorable experience in the heart of Madagascar's most famous island. Guests are invited to book their stay and explore the unique blend of comfort and culture offered by this exquisite hotel.

products.shortDescription: Experience the allure of White Sands National Park as you traverse endless gypsum dunes, witness stunning sunsets, and embark on thrilling sledding adventures amidst an otherworldly landscape.
products.description:
Discover the mesmerizing dunes of White Sands National Park. The largest gypsum dunefield in the world is one entrancing place, with hikes through the dunes, interpretive trails, and plenty of picnic areas to sled in the sand. And with Shaka Guide, youâ€™ll hear some of the incredible stories that make White Sands National Park such a fascinating place to be.

Here are just a few of the fun things you can do on the tour!

â€¢ Take a challenging hike through expansive dune fields at Alkali Flat Trailhead.
â€¢ Go on a stroll amidst the gypsum dunes at The Interdune Boardwalk.
â€¢ Visit the historic White Sands Visitor Center for informative exhibits and to chat with a ranger.
â€¢ Witness some of the park's diverse flora and fauna at the Dune Life Nature Trail.
â€¢ Explore the Playa Trail - a captivating path leading to ephemeral wetlands, known as playas, offering a unique opportunity to witness the fascinating interactions between sand and water.

KNOW BEFORE YOU GO:

Recommended Start Time: Before 9:00 a.m.
Tour Starting Point(s): The tour has four starting points: Route 70 coming from Las Cruces, NM, Route 54 near Tularosa, NM, Route 82 coming from Cloudcroft, NM, and Route 54 south of Alamogordo, NM.

products.name: Shaka Guide Mount Rainier National Park Audio Tour
products.shortDescription: Explore Mount Rainier's natural wonders with Shaka Guide's tour. Experience breathtaking vistas, pristine forests, and alpine adventures.
products.description:
Mount Rainier National Park is centered around an awe-inspiring, iconic volcano â€” Mount Rainier. It takes you through miles and miles of old-growth forest, up and down a rollercoaster of the Cascade Mountains. 


Lastly, it guides you past lakes, rivers, and waterfalls, and along scenic hikes through wildflower meadows, up mountains, and through woods.


The overlooks along the drive will take your breath away and the serpentine roads leading up to Paradise and Sunrise â€” the most popular sections of the park â€” will keep your heart pumping and your camera clicking.

Here are just a few of the fun things you can do on the tour:

â€¢ Explore the stunning alpine meadows of Paradise, where wildflowers bloom beneath the imposing backdrop of Mount Rainier's glaciers.

â€¢ Witness the first light of day at Sunrise Point, an overlook offering unrivaled views of the mountain's icy flanks and the surrounding wilderness.

â€¢ Wander through the ancient forest of the Grove of the Patriarchs, where colossal trees stand sentinel over a tranquil island oasis.

â€¢ Stand in awe of Narada Falls as it plunges gracefully over a rugged cliffside, sending misty rainbows through the crisp mountain air.

â€¢ Ascend to breathtaking heights aboard the Mount Rainier Gondola at Crystal Mountain.

KNOW BEFORE YOU GO:
Recommended Start Time: Before 8:00 a.m.
Tour Starting Point(s): Elbe, WA, Enumclaw, WA, Packwood, WA and Lava Falls, WA
Time to complete: 1-3 days

products.name: WINE LOVERS | Yarra Valley Wines Food & Wine Tours
products.shortDescription: Join this small-group tasting tour of the Yarra Valley to sample some of the region's finest cool-climate wine amidst beautiful scenery.
products.description:
Highlights/Inclusions:


  • Taste premium and flagship wines across 4 distinctive wineries offering their unique perspectives on the Yarra Valley region
  • Enjoy a locally made cheese platters with nibbles at usually the first winery 
  • Visit the only Domaine Chandon in Australia to appreciate their sparkling wines
  • Enjoy on a seasonal gourmet 2 course lunch (main course lunch followed by dessert) with a glass of wine at a winery
  • Discover the charm of a small group tour (maximum 10 guests) for a truly personalised experience
  • Appreciate the convenience of a central pickup & drop-off location

What's excluded: 


  • Hotel pick ups or drop offs

What to expect:


Experience a curated tour of Yarra Valley's renowned wineries with a small group, tasting wines from 4 distinct locations, each showcasing the region's unique terroir. Begin with a visit to the first winery, enjoying locally made cheese platters and nibbles. Explore Domaine Chandon, Australia's sole location, to savour their celebrated sparkling wines. Delight in a seasonal gourmet 2-course lunch paired with wine, featuring main course and dessert options. The intimate tour, limited to 10 guests, ensures a personalized journey.


What does the ticket price cover:


This tour includes all wines tastings, live commentary, clean and comfortable transportation from Melbourne in a modern mini-bus and plenty of good vibes.


Weekend, Peak & Public Holiday surcharge: 


Please note we've automatically added a surcharge to our prices on certain days (Fri - Sun $10pp and public holidays - $15pp). The additional fee covers the increased operating costs on these days which enables us to continue to provide you with amazing and high-quality tours throughout the year. 


Pickup details:

Time: 9:15AM**

**note we depart by 9:30AM so please arrive by the requested time. Any non-attendance is non-refundable & non-reschedulable as per our terms & conditions. 


Location: Arts Centre Melbourne 

Address: 100 St Kilda Road, Melbourne VIC 3004 

When you arrive in front of Arts Centre Melbourne, you can wait near the free-standing coffee shop (Protagonist). The host will pick you from around here.


Drop-off details: 

Time: 5:00PM in front of ACMI (Federation Square) 


Bookings during Low Season (June - August)


During our low season (June to August), we may cancel trips if attendance is low.  If this happens, we will notify you as soon as possible, usually at least two business days in advance.  We apologise for any inconvenience this may cause.


In case of cancellation, we will offer alternative dates, other tour options, or a full refund.

To check if your tour is likely to proceed, please contact us at contact@dancingkangarootours.com.au.


Thank you for booking with us and understanding the challenges of operating during the low season in Australia.

products.name: Wildlife Tours Australia: 1 Day Great Ocean Road Tour (Online Promo)
products.shortDescription:
Departing at 7:35 AM
Returning at 8:30 PM
Duration 12:00 Hrs
products.description:
TOUR CODE: WGORL

OPERATES: Daily

TOUR DURATION: 12 Hours

MAIN PICKUP LOCATION & TIME: Immigration Museum - 400 Flinders St, corner Market St, Melbourne @ 7:35am.

HIGHLIGHTS: 

  • Take a scenic coastal drive along the world-famous Great Ocean Road, a National Heritage Listed site
  • See the historic Memorial Arch and the Great Ocean Road sign, a perfect place for a photo opportunity
  • Search for Australian wildlife in its natural habitat 
  • Enjoy a guided walk through an ancient rainforest at the Great Otway National Park
  • Check out the amazing lookout views of the shipwreck coastline of Port Campbell National Park
  • Take a stroll along the beach of Loch Ard Gorge, surrounded by dramatic cliff walls and dramatic scenery
  • Take in  panoramic views at the 12 Apostles lookout in the delight of the afternoon sun

ITINERARY:

One of the most spectacular coastal drives in the world can be found on this Great Ocean Road tour! As we leave Melbourne, we cross the West Gate Bridge, a bridge that spans the width of the Yarra River, providing a link between the capital of Victoria and the second-largest city in the state of Victoria, Geelong.

Upon arrival in Anglesea, we get the first glimpse of our breathtaking southern coastline views; from here, we will twist and turn our way along one of the world's most spectacular coastal drives, which is listed as a National Heritage site. Throughout the drive, there will be plenty of opportunities to capture some awesome images, including the historic Memorial Arch at Eastern View and the introduction to the Great Ocean Road drive. 

It is advisable that you keep your eyes open as you pass through beachside towns such as Aireys Inlet, Lorne, Wye River and Kennett River in order to search for Australian wildlife, as you never know what you might come across. Guests will have time to explore and support the local economy of Apollo Bay as this is our lunch stop before heading into the Great Otway National Park to walk amongst towering ancient rainforest habitats.

The afternoon will be filled with marveling at the shipwreck coastline and gigantic limestone stacks, known as the 12 Apostles. As well, the cliff-side beaches of Loch Ard Gorge form part of the Port Campbell National Park, which has been carved out of the wild southern ocean over a period of time. A visit to the Great Ocean Road and the scenic locations that we visit along the way is one of the most beautiful experiences you can have when visiting Victoria.

Meals: N/A. Driving distance: 540km. Walking distance: 2-3km

INCLUSIONS:

  • National Park entry fees
  • Australian flora and fauna sightings
  • Guided rainforest walk (fitness level easy)
  • Hosted by an experienced driver guide
  • Modern air-conditioned coach travel
  • Comprehensive local tour commentary
  • Selected Melbourne inner-city pick-up/drop-off points
  • Audio & text translation app available in 10 different languages (Cantonese, Dutch, French, German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Mandarin, Portuguese, and Spanish)

EXCLUSIONS:

  • Any meals not indicated within the itinerary - at the guestâ€™s own expense. We provide plenty of opportunities for guests to support locals and buy snacks along the way.
  • Hotel transfers pre/post tour itinerary to a nominated pickup point.
  • Personal travel insurance is highly recommended
  • Personal expenses

WHAT TO BRING:

1L refillable water bottle, small day bag 5-7kg, hat, sunglasses, sunscreen, all-weather clothing ie. windbreaker, comfortable walking shoes, money for snacks and meals, camera to capture every moment!

CHILD POLICY:

Child fare prices apply from 0 to 12 years old. Infants aged 0 to 4 are not permitted to travel on adult laps and must be safely restrained within a child protective seat. Infant protective seats are free of charge and must be requested at the time of booking.

WEATHER:

Please ensure you have checked the average temperatures for the time of year you are travelling and have packed adequate clothing. In the event of rain or inclement weather, your experience will still go ahead, unless contacted by the provider.

IMPORTANT NOTES:

  • Mandatory passenger details are required at the time of booking: phone number.
  • Child fare prices apply to children aged between 0 to 12 years old.
  • Infants aged 0 to 4 are not permitted to travel on adult laps and must be safely restrained within a child protective seat. Infant seats are free of charge and must be requested at the time of booking.
  • This terrain is not suitable for mobility-impaired travellers, wheelchairs, walkers, prams or strollers. Limited storage space on our vehicle, baggage kept to 1 x 5-7kg day bag per person.
  • Autopia Tours reserves the right to alter the route or itinerary schedule during seasonal weather fluctuations and/or during park closures.
  • Please re-confirm your tour details within 7 days prior to departure on 03 9393 1300.
  • Private touring is available on request.

products.name: Shaka Guide Blue Ridge Parkway South Audio Tour App
products.shortDescription: Embark on a breathtaking journey with a local guide from Asheville to Cherokee along the Blue Ridge Parkway, where natural wonders await your exploration. Discover scenic vistas, history, and more.
products.description:
Explore the southernmost, and highest section of the Blue Ridge Parkway on this stunning road trip through the Blue Ridge Mountains. 


Visit waterfalls, hike to the top of mountains for panoramic views, or just enjoy the scenery from the beautiful overlooks. 


This tour takes you to some of the best spots on the Blue Ridge Parkway and shares the stories and myths of its people.

Here are just a few of the fun things you can do on the tour!

â€¢ Ascend to Mt. Pisgah's summit for panoramic Blue Ridge vistas, where hikers are rewarded with awe-inspiring views of the surrounding landscapes.

â€¢ Wander through the picturesque meadows and waterfalls of Graveyard Fields, a unique landscape with a history as intriguing as its name.

â€¢ Marvel at the elegance of Looking Glass Falls, a stunning waterfall cascading into a pristine pool below.

â€¢ Experience the beauty of Black Balsam Knob's high-altitude meadows, where a moderate hike leads to breathtaking vistas of the surrounding peaks.

â€¢ Discover the twin cascades of Soco Falls, nestled in a lush forest setting, providing a tranquil and picturesque stop along the Parkway.

KNOW BEFORE YOU GO:

Recommended Start Time: 8:00 a.m.
Tour Starting Point(s): The southern terminus of the Blue Ridge Parkway in Cherokee, NC, and on the Blue Ridge Parkway near Asheville, just off US-25 near the Biltmore.
Time to complete: 6-8+ hours

products.name: Shaka Guide Blue Ridge Parkway Asheville - Audio Tour App
products.shortDescription: Explore the Blue Ridge Parkway's beauty with Shaka Guide. Enjoy scenic wonders and cultural gems from Asheville to Blowing Rock.
products.description:
On this tour, weâ€™ll take you from Asheville to Blowing Rock, North Carolina, along 90 of the most scenic miles of the Blue Ridge Parkway. 


Here youâ€™ll find breathtaking views of mountain ranges fading into the horizon, high-elevation peaks with sweeping panoramic vistas, and close-up views of waterfalls and lakes. 


Youâ€™ll get to walk through dense forests of evergreens, drive through hillsides on fire with color in the fall, and hang out on heath balds that blaze with pink and purple come spring.

Here are just a few of the fun things you can do on the tour!

â€¢ Wander through a colorful tapestry of wildflowers and stunning vistas at Craggy Gardens, a high-elevation gem on the Parkway.

â€¢ Reach new heights at Mount Mitchell, the East Coast's highest peak, boasting sweeping panoramas and a rich alpine ecosystem.

â€¢ Marvel at engineering harmony with nature as you drive along Linn Cove Viaduct, a masterpiece hugging the contours of Grandfather Mountain.

â€¢ Witness the sheer power of nature at Linville Falls, where cascading waters carve through the landscape, offering a captivating spectacle.

products.name: QF 34 - Perth Airport Shuttle to Scarborough
products.shortDescription: Welcome to our Perth Airport Shuttle for guests arriving by Qantas flight QF 34! Enjoy a personalised welcome letter in your preferred language. Book now for a smooth ride to Scarborough!
products.description:
Welcome aboard the QF 34 Perth Airport Shuttle, your luxurious and efficient transport from Perth Airport via Perth, Fremantle and Cottesloe to Scarborough! As you embark on your journey, you'll be greeted with unparalleled hospitality and a personalized touch that sets us apart.


SERVICES INCLUDED

  • Terminal Pickup
  • Welcome Letter 
  • Hotel Drop off


Upon booking your seat with us, you'll receive a warm welcome letter crafted in your preferred language (available in French, German, or English), ensuring you feel right at home from the moment you step on board. 

With punctuality as our priority, you can trust us to adhere to your schedule, whether you're arriving in Perth for business or pleasure. We understand the importance of a smooth transition from the airport to the city, and our dedicated staff are here to ensure your journey is stress-free and enjoyable.

Experience the epitome of hospitality with the QF 34 Perth Airport Shuttle. Book your seat today and let us take care of the rest. Welcome to Perth!


Note

  • The Pickup is outside of Terminal 3 (Perth Airport) by the bus parking bay immediately after the T3 crosswalk.
  • Our welcome letter is available in French, German, or English. Please choose your language in the booking process. If you choose another language as mentioned above, you will receive an English flyer.
  • Hotel Drop Off will be in our system selected hotels in Scarborough.
  • No children under 8 years of age.

products.name: Fort Collins: Secrets of the city, Interactive Discovery Game
products.shortDescription: Explore the beautiful city of Fort Collins and have fun at the same time on this interactive, self-guided discovery game made by our local creator.
products.description:
Discover Fort Collins as never before with this original interactive game experience. While solving fun riddles, you'll get to know more about the history of this town in Colorado, meet Aunt Annie, might see one of America's last streetcars and get to see different pieces of art in public space.


Using your cell phone, your challenge will start at the Poudre River trail in Lee Martinez Park. Simply open your e-mail link and your adventure through this interesting town in Colorado will begin.


Curious facts:

Get to know more about the city, discover the secrets of the main attractions, and learn about curious facts that you won't read elsewhere.


Find monuments and hidden secrets:

Our local creator created an interactive walk through the city. Cryptic indications make you wind through the cities streets, inviting you to pay attention to details which you usually won't notice. Once you've arrived at the next stop, you will have to solve a question: open your eyes and mind and use your location to find the right answer!


Enjoy:

While doing this discovery trail, you will get to know the city from another point of view. Even locals discover new facts while doing secret city trails!


Solve 12 riddles created by our local creator. Sharpen your senses and appreciate the most wonderful (and little) details around you. Whether you know Fort Collins or have just started exploring here, get a perspective on the discovery that will inspire your curiosity wherever you go next.
products.additionalInformation:
• To play the trail, you click on the play link which you received by email from Secret City Trails

  • The play link is valid for 3 months starting at your activity date, so if you want to change the day or the time, you can do that without modifying your booking.

  • Once you click on the play link, you can invite 4 other people to play along with you

  • Once started, you have 15 days to finish the trail. So if you are tired or the weather changes, take a break and go ahead once ready to do so.

  • We suggest playing the trails during daylight hours to make it easier to discover clues and directions, which often can be found in the details 

  • If a trail is available in multiple languages, you will receive an English introduction mail, but you can select the language once you are about to start the game

products.name: â€˜VIVID 2024â€™ SPECIAL EDITION NIGHT PHOTOGRAPHY â€“ CIRCULAR QUAY
products.shortDescription: 3 hour workshop held on Sydney's Harbour Foreshore during the VIVID Festival. Spend an exciting evening learning from a working pro photographer as you capture Sydneyâ€™s beautiful VIVID lights and iconic landmarks at Circular Quay.
products.description:
This night photography workshop is run on various evenings throughout the VIVID Festival.


Runs from 6pm to 9pm 


Spend an exciting evening during Sydneyâ€™s VIVID Festival learning from a working pro photographer as you capture the stunning light installations and iconic harbour-side landmarks that the VIVID Sydney Festival has to offer from Circular Quay around the Sydney Harbour Foreshore. 

As the lights come on, and the city comes alive, you will be able to get amongst it and learn creative techniques to help you create postcard quality images in this fun, inspirational and eye-opening experience. Your night photography workshop begins with a harbour-side brief and introduction by your Tutor.

This beautiful annual event offers a unique opportunity to capture the colours of the city light projections with the guidance of a professional photographer. The Festival features breathtaking immersive light projections on the iconic Sydney Opera House sails and Harbour Bridge along with an outdoor exhibition of interactive light sculptures.

This workshop is designed for those photographers who want to get into the action and explore the beautiful lights using creative techniques involved in shooting after dark whilst utilising the creative light installations around Circular Quay. 

For beginners looking for a fun and exciting introduction to digital photography or enthusiasts looking to brush up on their technique. All you need is a Digital SLR or Mirrorless camera with full manual controls, a sturdy tripod and lots of memory space.


NOT SUITABLE FOR COMPACT CAMERAS WITHOUT FULL MANUAL CAPABILITY.


A TRIPOD IS ESSENTIAL FOR THIS WORKSHOP â€“ Please note â€“ we do NOT loan tripods.


* A final weather check will be conducted with the Bureau of Meteorology on the afternoon of each workshop.  This may lead to the workshop being postponed in cases of unfavourable weather reports.  The workshop may run in cases of light showers but not in persistent showers or heavy rain.


N.B. Classes are run subject to acquiring minimum numbers


MAXIMUM NO. OF STUDENTS PER CLASS IS 10


BASIC OVERVIEW OF SOME OF THE TOPICS THAT MAY BE COVERED:

  • Shooting the light installations of VIVID Festival
  • Night landscapes
  • Night portrait
  • Long exposure techniques
  • Using movement
  • Equipment
  • Working with available light
  • Introduction to manual exposure
  • Composition
  • Working with abstracts
  • Thinking outside the square
  • White balance techniques
  • Creative light painting techniques

THIS NIGHT PHOTOGRAPHY WORKSHOP IS SUITABLE FOR BOTH BEGINNERS AND AMATEURS USING DIGITAL SLR OR MIRRORLESS CAMERA WITH MANUAL CAPABILITY.


The workshop is not recommended for compact cameras without full manual mode.


You will need:

  • Your Camera(s)
  • A sturdy tripod (this is essential)
  • A selection of lenses if you have more than one and you would like to experiment with them
  • A torch (to be used to see your cameras control in the dark)
  • Lens Hood if you have one
  • Blank formatted memory Card(s)
  • Fully charged camera battery and spare if you have one
  • Your cameras manual(s) â€“ for referencing those hard to find features
  • Dress casual & comfortable with sensible shoes (you may get a little dirty at some locations)

Note: A tripod is ESSENTIAL for this workshop. A lens hood & wide angle lens are recommended. If you do not already have a lens hood or tripod â€“ you should consider purchasing them at your earliest convenience as they are an essential part of any good photography kit. 


THIS SYDNEY NIGHT PHOTOGRAPHY WORKSHOP IS $149 FOR 3HRS TUITION


Your fee includes the following:

  • Professional and experienced Photographer / Tutor for 3 hours tuition

products.description:
CF Montreal at Stade Saputo: a ticket to a sporting event is a window into the culture of a City. The modern trend of travel is local experiences, and what better way is there to understand a City than by immersing oneself as a sports fan? Youâ€™re guaranteed to engage in something that the local people care about. The experience can be historic and the memories are often: Witnessing the emotional attachment to teams and players as locals idolise their heroes. Learning the history behind team songs, rivalries, chants or other rituals to urge a team to victory. Reminiscing and recalling the event highlights whilst surrounded by likeminded fans afterwards. A packed ride home on local transport as local fans celebrate, complain and commiserate. Every game is unique! You donâ€™t know a city until youâ€™ve seen its sport. products.name: Shaka Guide Arches National Park Audio Tour Guide
products.shortDescription: Explore Arches National Park on a self-guided audio tour. Enjoy the independence of your own schedule and vehicle as you visit arches like Delicate Arch, Landscape Arch, and Double O Arch.
products.description:
Arches National Park is home to the highest concentration of natural stone arches in the world. 


With Shaka Guide you'll learn about the history and geology of this park, while you visit its most famous sites.

Here are just a few of the fun things you can do on the tour!
â€¢ Visit Landscape Arch - Americaâ€™s longest arch!
â€¢ Hike Delicate Arch Trail
â€¢ Take in miles of views from Panorama Point
â€¢ Discover the Garden of Eden to see mini arches, arches that are still being formed, and more

*Between April and October you must make an advance reservation to visit the park. Learn more in our FAQs below*

*This tour is available in both Classic and Reverse options - check out of FAQs below to learn more.*

KNOW BEFORE YOU GO:

Recommended Start Time: Before 8:00 a.m.
Tour Starting Point(s): Utah State Highway 191 a half mile north or south of the park entrance
Time to complete: 4+ hours

All Shaka Guide tours come with customer support and a satisfaction guarantee. Tours never expire.  

*Download the Shaka Guide app to access your purchased tours.*

This service simplifies the process so you can sit back and relax, and enjoy the mountain views as we drive through the rocky mountains.


(Please note that 1 to 6 Passenger Minivan capacity is subject to luggage/cargo limitations depending on the number of passengers)


Inclusions

â€¢ Meet and Greet at Calgary Airport (YYC) or Hotel of your choice

â€¢ Air-conditioned vehicle

â€¢ GST (Goods and Services Tax)

â€¢ Private transportation

â€¢ Calgary Airport Authority Arrival Pickup Fee for Van/SUV of $25.20 CAD

* Up to 10 hours a day, additional time available for a fee

Exclusions

products.additionalInformation:
(Please note that 1 to 6 Passenger Minivan capacity is subject to luggage/cargo limitations depending on the number of passengers)

Passenger Information

For Airport Arrivals

  • For airport arrivals, we will arrive at the scheduled time, please notify us of any flight delays and cancellations as soon as possible, we will also monitor your flight for delays and cancellations to the best of our ability and work to reschedule your pickup to meet you within 20 minutes of your arrival to accommodate for time it takes to clear customs and retrieve your luggage.
  • For international arrivals, we will meet you after you clear the customs area and pickup your luggage, then exit past the customs counter through the secure doors to the meeting area D.
  • For domestic arrivals, we will meet our clients either by the luggage carousal or meeting area A, B or C depending on your flight gate.
  • We will attempt to reach you upon arrival via your provided contact information, i.e. text, phone, or email.
  • We will also be holding a sign such as a Paper/iPhone/iPad with your name on it.

For pickups at hotels and other locations

  • We will attempt to reach you upon arrival via your provided contact information, i.e. text, phone, or email.

Inclusions

  • Air-conditioned vehicle
  • GST (Goods and Services Tax)
  • Private transportation
  • Calgary Airport Authority Arrival Minivan/SUV fee of $25.20 CAD
  • Transported by licenced and insured vehicle

Exclusions

  • Gratuity is not included in the base fare
  • If you are entering Banff, Yoho, or  Jasper National Park, there is an entry fee of $10.50 fee per person per day or a fee of $21.00 for Family/Group per day at the gate just after the City of Canmore highway exits, or purchase a discovery pass for individuals or groups up to 7 persons, good for one year at all of Canada`s National Parks
  • Child Car Seat (Required by Alberta law for children up to 6 years or up to 40 lbs.) Available for an additional fee
Other Information
  • If your are travelling to Banff or Lake Louise, please be sure you have obtained a National Park Pass with your itinerary, if you haven't obtained one yet, this can be obtained at the Banff National Park Gate by Canmore while on the way to your destination. Please check your travel itinerary, hotel, or with your travel agent to determine if you have paid these fees already. products.name: Montebello Islands 2025
products.shortDescription:
5 Day Fishing & Adventure Tours.
Season: July - November.
Departing From Exmouth.
products.description:
Montebello Islands


Get onboard Talasea II from July to November for a 5-day charter departing from Exmouth. When you get to the "Montes", expect action and
lots of it. Your days are filled with your choice of snorkeling,
diving, fishing, and Island exploring. The waters are teeming with Pelagics Spanish
Mackerel, Sail Fish, Marlin, and Tunas. The reef areas around the islands are
littered with Coral gardens and rock walls with Coral Trout, Mangrove jacks, and
big GTâ€™s. Fishing the deeper waters is an eye-opening experience with Red
Emperors, Crimson Sea Perch, Gold trevally, Rankin Cods, Big Robinson Sea Brim
some big Mangrove jacks, and more.

Once you step onboard Talasea II you can forget about the hassles of life for a few days. The Luxurious interior features rich timber
finishes and can accommodate 12 guests and four crew in six cabins with four
bathrooms. The spacious saloon encompasses the chefâ€™s galley, with a bar and
beer on tap. The flybridge and upper deck combine to make a fantastic
entertainment area with an outdoor kitchen and dining and large day beds.

With Blue Juice Charters everything is taken care of for you. All meals are provided and your fish are cleaned, filleted, packed, and frozen ready for you to take home. 

Credit card payments incur a 2% bank surcharge fee, where possible we recommend using direct transfer to avoid the additional fees.

products.name: CRADLE MOUNTAIN with TASMANIAN DEVILS: Burnie Shore excursion
products.shortDescription: Experience Tasmania's wilderness! Encounter iconic Tasmanian Devils, explore UNESCO-listed Cradle Mountain's pristine beauty, and capture unforgettable moments. Book your adventure today
products.description:
Our adventure begins promptly at 10:00 AM. However, if everyone is ready earlier, we'll set off sooner. This excursion is tailored specifically for cruise passengers seeking an opportunity to visit Cradle Mountain and encounter a Tasmanian Devil. We keep as a small group with a maximum of 20 guests. As a fully accreditated operator with Tasmania National Parks our vehices are allowed to enter the park and you do not need to use the shuttle buses which saves a lot of time and allows us to do more than other tour operators.

The journey to Cradle Mountain takes nearly 90 minutes, leading us to a UNESCO World Heritage-listed wilderness area renowned for its pristine lakes, ancient rainforests, and rugged peaks. Our initial destination is the breathtaking Dove Lake, nestled at the foot of Cradle Mountain.

From Dove Lake, we embark on a scenic walk to the iconic Boatshed, a charming wooden structure nestled along the lake's shores. As we wander along the well-marked trails, immerse yourself in the natural beauty of the area. The Boatshed provides an ideal setting for capturing memorable photographs and enjoying a moment of tranquillity amidst the wilderness.

Following our leisurely walk, we proceed with a visit to the Devils at Cradle sanctuary. Here, you'll have the chance to come face-to-face with Tasmania's most iconic yet endangered species, the Tasmanian Devil. Learn about these captivating creatures, their conservation efforts, and witness their playful antics up close. It's a rare opportunity to connect with
Australia's unique wildlife in their natural habitat. 

Next up if time allows is the Rainforest Circuit a 15 minute walk that provides an insight into the rainforest and a view of the many Tasmanian waterfalls. 

A quick stop at the Wilderness Gallery and the attached souvenir shop before we head  back to Burnie, aiming to arrive at approximately 3:30 PM. Please note that times may be adjusted if your cruise ship departs earlier.

This tour is suitable only for those capable of completing a short walk and willing to spend nearly three hours on the bus, navigating twisting roads. We kindly request that you join us promptly, as we may depart earlier and allocate additional time at Cradle Mountain if everyone arrives ahead of schedule. Our meeting point is easily accessible once you disembark
from the shuttle bus that transports you to Burnie. 

Entrance fees are included for both Cradle Mountain Park and the Devils at Cradle.

EACH GUEST WILL ALSO RECEIVE A FREE CRADLE MOUNTAIN BRANDED SOUVENIR:
Choose from a hip flask, glass water bottle, playing cards of Cradle Mountain buff.

REFUNDS:

You are free to cancel any time before 48 hours prior to your booking. We will fully refund any monies paid. Please give us as much notice as possible so that others are able to book your seats once vacant.  Within the 48 hour period we will refund for any medical issue. If your ship fails to dock we will refund 70% of the payment made. We have to do this to share the losses as we have buses all waiting with a full team of drivers. If you do not want to take this risk we suggest do not pre book and buy tickets once you arrive in Burnie. We normally have tickets available.

locationAddress.addressLine: Find us in the market where the cruise ship brings you from your cruise ship

products.additionalInformation: Please take the free shuttle bus from your cruise ship. Do come as fast as you can as if everyone arrives early we can depart earlier. You will find eGuide reception desk in the market set up for cruise ship passengers. For this trip we have very limited time for purchasing food and drinks so if you can bring with you. Water we will provide.

products.name: DISCOVERING TASMANIA: Burnie Shore excursion
products.shortDescription: Explore Tasmania hassle-free with eGuide. Encounter wildlife, sip local wines, whisky, and enjoy scenic stops. Trust us for a memorable journey and a guaranteed return to your cruise ship. Book your adventure now!"
products.description:
Explore Tasmania's captivating region in a little over 5 hours with a small group (max 21). At eGuide, reliability is key. Book with us for peace of mind, prioritizing your timely return to the cruise ship. Our tour starts from the farthest locations and end in Burnie township. With a backup vehicle on standby, missing the return has never happened. Trust us, a recognized leader in Australian tours. Discover Burnie's treasures worry-free, guaranteed return to your cruise ship.

Our adventure begins promptly at 10:00 AM, with flexibility for earlier ship departures. Should your ship leave earlier, fret not! We'll adjust the start time to 9:30 AM and notify you accordingly. Simply hop on the complimentary shuttle bus from the cruise ship to reach us. If you arrive ahead of time, take advantage of the opportunity to leisurely stroll along the boardwalk and explore the charming market stalls set up specifically for passengers like yourself. We'll conclude by returning to the starting point by 3:15 PM, and will adjust for earlier departures.


Tour Highlights:

Begin your adventure with a scenic 35-minute drive, to our first stop the George Woodhouse Lookout, where we'll pause for a few minutes for your first photo opportunity.

Journey onwards to Wings Wildlife Park, a mere 10-minute drive away, where encounters with Tasmanian wildlife await, including Tasmania Devils, Wombats, Koala and Kangaroos. Enjoy an hour-long exploration, with entrance fees included.

Next, venture to Leven Valley Vineyard, nestled amidst rolling hills and lush vine rows where a wine tasting or a non-alcoholic local drink is included.

Relax as we drive for 30 minutes to the charming coastal village of Penguin where we spend a quick 10 minutes to view the beautiful beach views, and take a picture of the iconic Penguin sculpture. 

Heading back to Burnie we visit the Emu Valley Rhododendron Gardens, where there is a high chance to see a platypus in the wild. Spend 30 minutes exploring, with entrance fees included.

Next for a 25-minute stop at Hellyerâ€™s Distillery, to sample two award-winning whiskies and whisky cream amidst stunning countryside views. For none whisky drinkers a non-alcoholic drink is available.

Bid adieu to the wonders of Tasmania for a quick photo stop at the Upper Burnie Lookout, offering a view of your cruise ship against the Tasmanian horizon.


REFUNDS:
You are free to cancel any time before 48 hours prior to your booking. We will fully refund any monies paid. Please give us as much notice as possible so that others are able to book your seats once vacant.  Within the 48 hour period we will refund for any medical issue. If your ship fails to dock we will refund 60% of the payment made. We have to do this to share the losses as we have buses all waiting with a full team of drivers. If you do not want to take this risk we suggest do not pre book and buy tickets once you arrive in Burnie. We normally have tickets available.

locationAddress.addressLine: Find us in the market where the shuttle bus drops you from your cruise ship

products.additionalInformation: Please take the free shuttle bus as soon as you can to Burnie. You will find us in the market, look for the eGuide reception desk. Please do ensure you are with us at least 15 minutes prior to your departure time so that we can load and depart on time.  And if everyone is present we can leave early.

products.name: HELLYERS ROAD EXPERIENCE: Burnie Shore excursion
products.shortDescription: Indulge in Tasmania's whisky heritage with the Hellyers Road Experience. Limited spots ensure personalized attention. Discover exclusive tastings, distillery tours, and regional delights. Book your unforgettable journey now!
products.description:
The Hellyers Road Experience offers a discovery for whisky aficionados and curious travellers alike. Departing at 1 pm and returning at 3:30 pm, this exclusive tour promises an unforgettable journey through the heart of Tasmania's whisky heritage.

Limited to a maximum of 20 guests, this intimate experience ensures personalized attention and a truly immersive adventure. Your excursion begins with a lunch featuring regional tasting platters, accompanied by coffee and delectable whisky cream fudge.

Next, delve into the inner workings of Hellyers Road Distillery with a guided tour that grants you exclusive access to whisky straight from the cask. Witness the artistry and craftsmanship behind each batch as you learn about the intricate distillation process.

As the afternoon unfolds, delight your senses with a curated tasting of Hellyers Road's premium whiskies and creamy liqueurs. From smooth single malts to rich and velvety liqueurs, each sip tells a story of Tasmania's rich whisky-making heritage. Guided by expert connoisseurs, you'll explore the nuances of flavor, aroma, and texture, gaining a deeper appreciation for the
artistry that goes into every drop. 

Whether you're a seasoned whisky enthusiast or simply curious to explore Tasmania's renowned distilling traditions, the Hellyers Road Experience promises an unforgettable journey through the world of fine spirits. 

Don't miss your chance to embark on this exclusive Burnie Shore Excursion and discover the essence of Tasmanian whisky excellence.


REFUNDS:
You are free to cancel any time before 7 days prior to your booking. We will fully refund any monies paid. Please give us as much notice as possible so that others are able to book your seats once vacant.  Within the 7 day period we will refund for any medical issue. If your ship fails to dock we will refund 60% of the payment made. We have to do this to share the losses as we have buses all waiting and food prepared.

products.name: BURNIE ATTRACTIONS BUS: Burnie Shore excursion
products.shortDescription: Experience Burnie's highlights with the excellent value Burnie Attractions Bus tour. Discover views from Upper Burnie Lookout, explore Emu Valley Rhododendron Gardens,  Fernglade Reserve, and visit the charming village of Penguin.
products.description:
Embark on a beautiful journey around Burnie with the very popular Burnie Attractions Bus. Designed to offer a relaxed and immersive experience with a series of short stops, our two-hour guided tour is perfect for cruisers eager to capture the essence of Tasmania's northwest coast and gain insights from our knowledgeable local guide.

With multiple departures available daily, you can be confident that you'll return to your cruise ship with plenty of time to spare. Our standby backup vehicle ensures a stress-free adventure, guaranteeing no missed departures in Burnie.

Tour Highlights:

Upper Burnie Lookout: Kick off your adventure with a scenic drive to the Upper Burnie Lookout, offering panoramic views of the Bass Strait and the picturesque harbour. Don't forget to snap a photo of your cruise ship below. (5 minutes)

Emu Valley Rhododendron Gardens: Immerse yourself in the natural splendour of Tasmania at the renowned Emu Valley Rhododendron Gardens. Spanning over 11 hectares, this botanical wonderland showcases an array of rhododendrons, azaleas, and exotic flora. Marvel at the kaleidoscope of colours and tranquil beauty, with towering trees and cascading waterfalls providing a picturesque backdrop. Keep an eye out for a platypus in the wild! 
(30 minutes)

Fernglade Reserve: Delve into the tranquillity of Fernglade Reserve, where pristine wilderness meets abundant wildlife. Encounter native wonders such as the elusive platypus and vibrant birdlife, offering a glimpse into Tasmania's wilderness. (10 minutes)

Charming Village of Penguin: Wrap up your excursion with a brief visit to the charming seaside village of Penguin, named for its delightful little penguin colonies. Take in the scenic esplanade and sandy shores, and be sure to capture a photo with the iconic Penguin sculpture, immersing yourself in the warm community spirit and coastal charm. (10 minutes)

Regional museum: Our last stop is the museum which is free to enter and has a reconstructed street that shows what Burnie was like in the 1800's. If disembarking from this stop you have a 5 minute walk to the shuttle bus that takes you back to your crusie ship.

Experience the authentic essence of Tasmania's northwest coast with our Burnie Attractions Bus Shore Excursion. Reserve your spot now for a rewarding and unforgettable adventure!

ENTRANCE FEES FOR THE GARDENS ARE INCLUDED

You are free to cancel any time before 48 hours prior to your booking. We will fully refund any monies paid. We hold back tickets for sale on the day, so if showing sold out please come to the eGuide desk once you reach Burnie. Tickets are sold on a first come first served basis.

locationAddress.addressLine: Find us in the market where the bus drops you from your ship

products.additionalInformation: To find us please take the free shuttle bus from your ship and turn into the market when you get off the bus.  Look for the eGuide reception desk. Please come to us at any time prior to your booked time to collect your entrance ticket to the Gardens.  Please meet us 15 minutes before your departure to allow time to board the bus and depart on time.
